article.headline: BYU 86, Weber State 65
article.story: PROVO, Utah (AP) -- Rafael Araujo scored 23 points and pulled down seven rebounds and Mike Hall scored a career high 22 in Brigham Young's 86-65 win Saturday over Weber State. Kevin Woodbury added 13 points and Luiz Lemes tied his career best with nine assists for the Cougars (7-1), who remained unbeaten at home. The Wildcats (5-4) were playing without leading scorer and rebounder Slobodan Ocokoljic, who missed the game with the flu. John Hamilton scored 18 and Lance Allred had 15 points for Weber State, which was dominated inside without Ocokoljic. The Cougars outscored the Wildcats 44-22 in the lane and outrebounded Weber State 31-25, including 22 offensive boards. BYU also shot 58 percent (32-for-55) from the field while beating the Wildcats for the 15th time in 15 games at the Mariott Center. Hall's previous career-high was 19 against Utah Valley State on Nov. 29. Lemes also had nine assists on Dec. 6 in a win over Oklahoma State.
